titleStmt.title: The treasury of deuotion Contayning diuers pious prayers, & exercises both practicall, and speculatiue. Togeather vvith the seauen little offices in Latin and English: and sundry other deuotions, for yong beginners in vertue. Collected by I.VV.P.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A15507 of text S102528 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 25773). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 265 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 295 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: The treasury of deuotion Contayning diuers pious prayers, & exercises both practicall, and speculatiue. Togeather vvith the seauen little offices in Latin and English: and sundry other deuotions, for yong beginners in vertue. Collected by I.VV.P.
titleStmt.author: Wilson, John, ca. 1575-ca. 1645?

notesStmt.note: Place of publication and printer's name from STC.

C4r is a separate title page, with same imprint date, reading: Weekly little offices in Latin and English. Whereof that of our B. Ladyes conception, is to be sayed euery day; togeather with one of the other, set downe in order for the weeke. Collected by I.VV.P.
Some print faded; some pages torn.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
